item.title: Faster way to code search of 81 squares?
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“bobert5696, post:4, topic:8629”]thanks so much, i figuered you could somehow do it with arrays, but i wasnt sure how to cause i’v ehad no experience with them i think i understand it pretty much, but what is the point of the the stuff in bold:

if (FindColor(x, y, Allc[i], 118, 44, 147, 76)) [b]and (not(Foundb))[/b] then begin [b]Foundb:= True;[/b] Ab:= i; end;
i’ve spent a while trying to figure that out and i cant, but everything else i think i get, you have no idea how helpful this is :)[/quote]
“Foundb:= True;”

Foundb is a boolean. Booleans are variables that can either be set to true or false. When it found the color i made it set to true so it stopped looking for another color if Ac hadn’t finished

Read full topic
item.source: Faster way to code search of 81 squares?

item.title: Faster way to code search of 81 squares?
item.dc:creator: @Mad_Cow Mad Cow
item.description:
@Mad_Cow wrote:

[quote=“XxKanexX, post:3, topic:8629”]Mad cow you forget the ab section. I wrote one, too.

[code]
var Allc: array [1…81] of Integer;
var ab, ac: Integer;

procedure LoadColors;
begin
Allc[1]:= 1804768;
Allc[2]:= 1385384;
Allc[3]:= 14803428;
Allc[4]:= 11016981;
Allc[5]:= 936558;
Allc[6]:= 13705240;
Allc[7]:= 1184277;
Allc[8]:= 1812704;
Allc[9]:= 14689051;
Allc[10]:= 498170;
Allc[11]:= 114921;

//Add more here.
end;

procedure FindColors;
var i, u, x, y: Integer;
var Foundb, Foundc: Boolean;
begin
LoadColors;
for i:= 1 to 81 do
begin
if (Allc[i] <= -1) then
begin
u:= i;
break;
end;
end;
for i:= 1 to u do
begin
if (FindColor(x, y, Allc[i], 118, 44, 147, 76)) and (not(Foundb)) then
begin
Foundb:= True;
Ab:= i;
end;
if (FindColor(x, y, Allc[i], 117, 81, 149, 112)) and (not(Foundc)) then
begin
Foundc:= True;
Ac:= i;
end;
end;
end;

begin
FindColors;
end.
[/code][/quote]

Thanks I made it without using SCAR so I couldn’t test it.

Mad Cow

item.title: Faster way to code search of 81 squares?
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

Mad cow you forget the ab section. I wrote one, too.

var Allc: array [1..81] of Integer;
var ab, ac: Integer;

procedure LoadColors;
begin
  Allc[1]:= 1804768;
  Allc[2]:= 1385384;
  Allc[3]:= 14803428;
  Allc[4]:= 11016981;
  Allc[5]:= 936558;
  Allc[6]:= 13705240;
  Allc[7]:= 1184277;
  Allc[8]:= 1812704;
  Allc[9]:= 14689051;
  Allc[10]:= 498170;
  Allc[11]:= 114921;
  
  //Add more here.
end;

procedure FindColors;
var i, u, x, y: Integer;
var Foundb, Foundc: Boolean;
begin
  LoadColors;
  for i:= 1 to 81 do
  begin
    if (Allc[i] <= -1) then
    begin
      u:= i;
      break;
    end;
  end;
  for i:= 1 to u do
  begin
    if (FindColor(x, y, Allc[i], 118, 44, 147, 76)) and (not(Foundb)) then
    begin
      Foundb:= True;
      Ab:= i;
    end;
    if (FindColor(x, y, Allc[i], 117, 81, 149, 112)) and (not(Foundc)) then
    begin
      Foundc:= True;
      Ac:= i;
    end;
  end;
end;

begin
  FindColors;
end.

item.source: Faster way to code search of 81 squares?

item.title: Faster way to code search of 81 squares?
item.dc:creator: @Mad_Cow Mad Cow
item.description:
@Mad_Cow wrote:

I just made this up for you.

[scar]program ColorFinder;
var
Color : Array[1…81] of Integer;
X, Y, A, AC : Integer;

procedure FindColors;
begin
Color[1] := 982753;
Color[2] := 9824643;
Color[3] := 9346;
Color[4] := 436853;
Color[5] := 123523;
Color[6] := 264752;
Color[7] := 923527;
//etc
repeat
A := A + 1;
if(FindColor(X, Y, Color[A], 117, 81, 149, 112)) then
AC := A;
until(A = 81)
end;

begin
A := 0;
FindColors;
end.[/scar]

Read full topic

item.title: Faster way to code search of 81 squares?
item.dc:creator: @bobert5696 bobert5696
item.description:
@bobert5696 wrote:

is there an easier way to do this than what im doing? heres a snippet of my code:

[code]//a,b
if (findcolor(x,y,1804768,118,44,147,76))then
ab := 1
else
if (findcolor(x,y,1385384,118,44,147,76))then
ab := 2
else
if (findcolor(x,y,14803428,118,44,147,76))then
ab := 3
else
if (findcolor(x,y,11016981,118,44,147,76))then
ab := 4
else
if (findcolor(x,y,936558,118,44,147,76))then
ab := 5
else
if (findcolor(x,y,13705240,118,44,147,76))then
ab := 6
else
if (findcolor(x,y,1184277,118,44,147,76))then
ab := 7
else
if (findcolor(x,y,1812704,118,44,147,76))then
ab := 8
else
if (findcolor(x,y,14689051,118,44,147,76))then
ab := 9
else
if (findcolor(x,y,498170,118,44,147,76))or
(findcolor(x,y,114921,118,44,147,76))then
ab := 11;

//a,c
if (findcolor(x,y,1804768,117,81,149,112))then
ac := 1
else
if (findcolor(x,y,1385384,117,81,149,112))then
ac := 2
else
if (findcolor(x,y,14803428,117,81,149,112))then
ac := 3
else
if (findcolor(x,y,11016981,117,81,149,112))then
ac := 4
else
if (findcolor(x,y,936558,117,81,149,112))then
ac := 5
else
if (findcolor(x,y,13705240,117,81,149,112))then
ac := 6
else
if (findcolor(x,y,1184277,117,81,149,112))then
ac := 7
else
if (findcolor(x,y,1812704,117,81,149,112))then
ac := 8
else
if (findcolor(x,y,14689051,117,81,149,112))then
ac := 9
else
if (findcolor(x,y,498170,117,81,149,112))or
(findcolor(x,y,114921,117,81,149,112))then
ac := 11;
[/code]

i need to do that for 81 sqaures, all checking for the same color, but in different coords, is there an easier way to code this (im at 1800 lines of code, and not even half way done with only the color finding part of the script, plus it will take forever to add all the coords to all of them, i stoped adding coords after 3 of them, i was gonnago back and add them)
